==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|type=12}}

===Etymology===
Literally: "afraid of one's wife". It is believed that if a man is ticklish, it is a sign of fear of his present or future wife.

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=pàlǎopo
|cat=id
}}

===Idiom===
{{zh-idiom}}

# to be [[henpecked]]; to be afraid of one's wife
# [[ticklish]] {{gloss|of a man}}
